title: 🎬 "Working Title" Film Project 🎬
description: 暗号通貨の領域を超えて、Cardano、Proj.Catalyst、そしてそれが開発者や起業家、そして世界に提供するものについて知っている人は非常に少ない。Catalystと、それが開発者、起業家、そして世界に提供するすべてのもの。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers want to make a film about Cardano. Besides this, the project is very limited in defining various aspects of how this will be achieved.  The proposes give a general plan (Story development, project dev, secure financing, pre-production etc) but it feels like it is not enough for a film project. I would expect to at least have a script and a trailer for deciding whether it would be a worthwhile investment. Besides this, I would also expect to have some input from IOG, so attaining letters of intention (for participation in the film) from people like Charles Hoskinson would have improved the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is made up of 2 persons who declare that they have 'combined 38 yrs entertainment industry experience'. Unfortunately, this is not of much comfort and uploading CVs would have been more ideal. There is a linked-in link to somebody named Jay Hunter who seems to be the co-proposer but this is not clearly indicated.  Nonetheless this person seems to be an actor based on IMDB and also has some minor experience in production.
This proposal is asking for $56,000 but it will need more financing in future proposals. This means that if this proposal is awarded, it could potentially never come to fruition if future proposals are not also awarded.
f6_assessments.q2: Vague terms such as "facilitate maximum community involvement" and about submitting future proposals. There is no clear goals and even more so there are no assurances as to the future of the project. While the final goal is to produce a film, there are no metric to assess the desired quality of such a film and the proposal itself says that it will require further financing.

f6_assessments.q0: Using movies to promote catalyst to reach new proposers is a great idea to me. The problem stated in this proposal has its place in this challenge. My issue is that the proposer doesn't clearly explain how this project will beneefit the cardano ecosystem. I would also want to see some strong KPIs to back the idea. Du to a lack of critical informations, I don't see how how this proposal will scale in future fund. I think that with some adjustements, this proposal have good chances to be funded.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal contains  ressources and links about the team. According to the informations provided, the team has ressources to complete the project. They provided a roadmap and a budget breakdown. I would prefer and suggest that these informations be on the proposal, instead of providing outside files. From the files provided, the budget is broken down but I'm not able to judge if it appropriate. I didn't find a roadmap or a timetable, so I think they are missing. To sum it up, this project lacks a clear plan and some critical information to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: I didn't see a roadmap and milestones. I also didn't see KPIs on this proposal. These informations are critical, in order to track the progress of the project. Even though we know what they are trying to build and how, the missing informations make this project difficult to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: An interesting idea but something which I believe may not get the engagement it seeks to bring to cardano and catalyst. The idea to create a feature film seems to be an exciting one on the face of it, but the proposal is looking to secure funding to create the screenplay and link up with existing community members for product placement and I would suggest, at this point, it will not provide any proposer outreach to the requirements desired.
f6_assessments.q1: With my 15 years of experience in marketing, I feel that this proposal will struggle to deliver a solid return or provide adequate KPIs to review success criteria. There is a broad brush approach to the delivery of the final film with the aim to reach a 'global audience' through tapping into an action/adventure entertainment market. I struggle to believe there will be the interest in this at that scale, and that a more refined audience segmentation would better suit any launch - a defined list of target consumers who may have interest in crypto but lack knowledge may provide the nudge required to investigate Cardano for example. In the proposal, there are a number of studios mentioned, but no verification of the relationships held with those organisations. The proposer should add more information here, perhaps specific examples of previous work with those studios, to support these claims. I also don't see any scalability in such an endeavour, and though their short-term goals are to engage with the community, it is not hitting the brief of "proposer outreach" at this time. Additionally, the requested budget only covers the first part of their roadmap, and there is no indication of cost for the other parts - if this is to be taken forward, there needs to be some indication of the cost for the delivery of the entire project. Delivering a screenplay without oversight of the full costs is not a good use of community money in my opinion.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal states they will create a "feature film & global distribution" but what they are actually requesting is seed money to create a screenplay, which they hope to supplement with paid-for product placement/advertising. The metrics are too vague to be auditable or measurable. There needs to be a business case developed already, not promised in the next phase. Additionally, marketing for a film is not cheap and the proposer needs to provide much more detail on their audience, geographies, advertising mediums, etc. than just provide a generic line on out of home and social media advertising. I would ask that this proposer returns with a much more detailed business case, outlining overall budget requirements, timescales and risks that may impact the project.
